Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The resulting root-mean-square ( rms ) roughness of active layer films was estimated to be 2.6 , 1.8 , 1.0 , and 2.2 nm for PffBB-10:PC71BM , PffBB-10:PC71BM , PffBB-12:PC71BM , PffBB-14:PC71BM , and PffBB-16:PC71BM blend , respectively.

| --- |
| PffBB-10:PC71BM |
| PffBB-10:PC71BM |
| PffBB-12:PC71BM |
| PffBB-14:PC71BM |
| PffBB-16:PC71BM |

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-10:PC71BM |
| PffBB-10:PC71BM |
| PffBB-12:PC71BM |
| PffBB-14:PC71BM |
| PffBB-16:PC71BM |

These are the entities in the paragraph that refer clearly to material names. The colon (:) is included in the material names as they appear in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The resulting root-mean-square ( rms ) roughness of active layer films was estimated to be 2.6 , 1.8 , 1.0 , and 2.2 nm for PffBB-10:PC71BM , PffBB-10:PC71BM , PffBB-12:PC71BM , PffBB-14:PC71BM , and PffBB-16:PC71BM blend , respectively.

The paragraph mentions the property "roughness" multiple times, but with the qualifier "resulting root-mean-square (rms)" only before the first mention. To be precise, all the following mentions of "roughness" should be read as "rms roughness". Therefore, all the entities are named as "roughness of [compound name]".

The entities in this table clearly refer to material properties, as they describe the roughness of active layer films for different compounds.

Paragraph: The resulting root-mean-square ( rms ) roughness of active layer films was estimated to be 2.6 , 1.8 , 1.0 , and 2.2 nm for PffBB-10:PC71BM , PffBB-10:PC71BM , PffBB-12:PC71BM , PffBB-14:PC71BM , and PffBB-16:PC71BM blend , respectively.

Note: Since the property value "rms roughness of active layer films" is mentioned only once in the paragraph, I included it as a descriptive text in the table for better understanding. However, if we strictly follow the instruction and only identify the specific numerical values, then we should exclude it from the table. In that case, the table would only contain the numerical values for each blend.

| 2.2 nm |

These values represent the rms roughness of active layer films for each of the following blends: PffBB-10:PC71BM, PffBB-10:PC71BM, PffBB-12:PC71BM, PffBB-14:PC71BM, and PffBB-16:PC71BM.
